alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 03 at 3:48AM MST until February 05 at 4:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Southwest winds 40 to 55 mph, with gusts up to 75 mph, are possible. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread blowing and drifting snow is possible from Thursday night through early Friday afternoon before temperatures climb above freezing. Near whiteout conditions are possible over this timeframe, with the potential for complete lane blockages in areas susceptible to significant drifting.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates.

area.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
